bboxes.raw_text:
Veterans holding permanentGI
life insurance policies may bor-
row up to 95 percent of their
policies: cash surrender value
to meet financial emergencies,
said Manager Of VAS Arizona
regional office.


While reducing the amount Of
protection, It does leave the pol
icy in force. If the policy Is
surrendered for cash all protec-
tion under the insurance ceases
and cannot be renewed nor re-
instated, Sanders said.


Annual interest on CT policy
loans IL charged at four per-
cent on the unpaid balance. II
not paid, It Is added to the loan
principal and begins to draw In
terest.


Repayment Of the principal on
the loan may be made In the
amounts Of SIS or any multiple
thereof and at any time before
default in payment Of premiums.

LOS ANGELES Willie Bryant,
SO, called the mayor Of Har-
lem" died Feb. % in his apart
ment.


Bryant, a veteran Of the enter
tainment field. gained recognition
in his Broadway role in Nam
ba's Daughters. starring Ethel
Waters.


He had appeared in several
movies. stage productions and
televiSion.


Bryant started as a candy ven
dor in Chicago at the Grand Thea
tire, but in few years he was
a top star. He took the first
troupe Of Negro entertainers
overseas during World War Two.


He discovered Ella Fitzgerald
and aided the careers Of Dakota
Station, Earl Hines and others.


Bryant wrote songs and was a
popular disc jockey.

NEW YORK Lena Horne, Steve
Allen and Sammy Davis, Jr., are
co-chairmen of a spoons oring
committee for a nationwide
closed circuit television program
planned by the National Associa-
rion for the Advancement Of Col
ored People for next May IA,
Roy Wilkins, NAACP executive
secretary, announced.


The program will observe the
tenth anniversary Of the United
States Supreme Court historic
school desegregauon ruling
handed down on May II. 1854.


Miss Horne and Mr.. Allen,
as West Coast co-chairmen, will
head a working committee from
Los Angeles, while Mr.. Davis
will chair a similar committee
in New York. Mr.. Davis, who
will be in rehearsal for his new
Broadway musical Golden Boy
at the time, will also perform on
the telecast.


The tenth anniversary pro-
gram, a two-hour affair, Is now
in process of preparation, Mr..
wilkins said. Combining top en-
rertainment with meaningful
purpose, 1t will include many
major stars of Broadway and
Hollywood as we'll as persons
who played leading roles in the
origin and implementation Of the
Supreme Court decision.


The program will originate live
from NewYork and Hollywood and
will be relayed to upwards Of
80 cities across the country via
the Freedom Network. organized
for this particular broadcast. 1t
will be the first use of closed
circuit teleWsion for a presen-
tation Of this scope and import
ance.


The observance, Mr.. Wilkins
added, Twill not only commem-
crate high-point in the century,
old struggle for full citizenship
for Negro Americans. but Is also
intended to rally popular sup
port in q final drive to eliminate
racism from all aspects Of Amer-
lean life"

Compensation for sickness or
disability in 1868, apply to
amounts received as compensa-
ton for sickness or disability,
George D. Patterson, Director
Of Internal Revenue for Arizona,
said today. Often, the payments
may be exempt or partly exempt
from income tax.


Document SOLO which furnishes
more detailed information on this
subject is available upon request
from the Internal Revenue Ser
vice.

full articles.headline:
WILLIE BRYANT


DIES IN CALIFORNIA

SO, called the mayor Of Har-

ment.


Bryant, a veteran Of the enter

Head Program
